com.cloudera.oryx.als.serving.candidate

Interface CandidateFilter

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    LocationSensitiveHashFilter

    public interface CandidateFilter

    Implementations of this interface speed up the recommendation process by pre-selecting a set of items that are the only possible candidates for recommendation, or, are the most likely to be top recommendations.

    For example, an implementation might know that most items in the model, while useful as data, are not recommendable since they are old -- out of date, or at least, undesirable enough as recommendations to be excluded. It could pre-compute which items are eligible and

    This is a form of filtering, but, differs from the filtering provided by RescorerProvider. That is a run-time, per-request filter; this class represents a more global, precomputed filtering that is not parameterized by the request.

    This is quite a low-level API and should be considered "advanced" usage; use a RescorerProvider unless it's clear that it is not fast enough.

    Implementations should define a constructor that accepts a parameter of type LongObjectMap. This is a reference to the "Y" matrix in the model -- item-feature matrix. Access to Y is protected by a lock, but, the implementation can assume that it is locked for reading (not writing) during the constructor call, and is locked for reading (not writing) during a call to getCandidateIterator(float[][]) and while the result of that method is used. So, implementations may save and use a reference to Y if it is only used in the context of these methods and only for reading.

    Author:
    Sean Owen
    See Also:
    RescorerProvider

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addItem(String itemID)
      Note a new item has appeared at run-time.
      Collection<Iterator<LongObjectMap.MapEntry<float[]>>> getCandidateIterator(float[][] userVectors) 

    • Method Detail

      • getCandidateIterator

        Collection<Iterator<LongObjectMap.MapEntry<float[]>>> getCandidateIterator(float[][] userVectors)
        Parameters:
        userVectors - user feature vector(s) for which recommendations are being made. This may or may not influence which items are returned. Use StringLongMapping.toLong(String) to find the numeric internal ID for a given string ID.
        Returns:
        a set of items most likely to be a good recommendation for the given users. These are returned as item ID / vector pairs (LongObjectMap's MapEntry). They are returned as an Iterator, and not just one, but potentially many. If several are returned, then the caller can process the Iterators in parallel for speed.

      • addItem

        void addItem(String itemID)
        Note a new item has appeared at run-time.
        Parameters:
        itemID - ID of new item
